pattern uses us terminology you will note that my starting chain for a double_crochet and half_double_crochet is 2 i e ch2 this is just a personal preference you are welcome to start with ch3 for a double_crochet and ch2 for a half_double_crochet or even start with a standing stitch do what is comfortable for you stitch counts for the corner are given separately to stitches per side chain spaces will be given separately to the stitches per side blue parentheses are used in some of the trickier rounds giving further instructions and hints to help get your stitch placement right black parentheses indicate a repeat a specified set of stitches to be repeated the indicated amount of times square brackets indicate a repeat that may contain smaller repeats within you will need to repeat this full set of instructions the specified amount of times curly brackets indicate a complete corner * * indicates a complete repeat for a side please note that sometimes tutorials and patterns are photographed at different times which may result in you seeing different hook sizes in the photos please always stick to what the written pattern says if you are using a kit or matching my gauge the pattern is written for colourway 1 if you are following colourway 2 there will be certain rounds where the end instructions such as fasten_off and secure or do not end off might not apply keep a close eye on the colour changes listed on page 3 and 4 to continue working in the same colour you just have to slip_stitch into the starting stitch or space and begin as the pattern instructs in certain rounds of the pattern you will need to cut your yarn fasten_off and join in the indicated stitch as the pattern instructs please note if you are using aurora in conjunction with any of my other squares to make a blanket you may need to hook down for the last few rounds of the square to obtain the correct final size to match with the sizes of the other squares i have available there are several rounds of surface stitches in this square it may be necessary to hook up when doing these rounds if you hook up remember to hook back down to your original hook size before continuing the square several rounds mention the hidden stitch first what is this hidden stitch when you have completed your corner it often hides that first stitch after the corner on the previous round so always move the corner slightly to work that first stitch this stitch is counted as the first stitch unless you are asked to skip the hidden st only skip the hidden stitch where i ve indicated to do so
